common_issues.title: Pieces OS LTM and High CPU Usage Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues enabling Long Term Memory (LTM) and experiencing high CPU usage, particularly in Windows with apps like Slack, Discord, and Edge. Proposed solutions include verifying permissions, restarting Pieces OS, updating to the latest version, and waiting for upcoming patches addressing LTM2 performance and WebView2 conflicts.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Problem:** 
- User (@kwburgess) encountered issues activating the Long Term Memory (LTM) feature in PiecesOS.

**Key points raised:**
- User reported the issue and provided details.
- The support bot suggested relevant resources and existing issues.
- Pieces support agent (@mark-at-pieces) identified the issue as likely a permissioning problem.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
- Support agent (@mark-at-pieces) suggested verifying PiecesOS permissions for screen & system recording and accessibility.
- User confirmed they enabled all necessary permissions previously.

**Current status/outcome:**
- User acknowledged the permission issue and resolved it.
- Activation of LTM likely successful.

**Additional notes:**
- User expressed gratitude for the quick response and identified the solution.

**Overall, the issue was resolved quickly and efficiently thanks to the collaboration between the user and Pieces support team.**

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Conversation Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Pieces OS users are experiencing high CPU usage, especially with LTM2 enabled.
* The issue affects Windows 10 and 11, and potentially macOS.
* Microsoft Edge and VSCode are particularly affected.
* The issue seems to be related to WebView2.

**Problems Identified:**

* High CPU usage impacting performance.
* Microsoft Edge sluggishness and scrolling issues.
* High CPU spikes even with LTM2 disabled.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix released for initial issue but further improvements needed.
* Another patch released for version 11.2.2 to address the problem.
* Investigation ongoing for further optimization.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Ongoing issue with some users still experiencing high CPU usage.
* Edge issue appears to be resolved for some users with an update to Microsoft Edge and WebView2 Runtime.
* Temporary workaround of turning LTM2 off and on does not work consistently.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a more permanent solution and expects to have a fix within the next week.

**Additional Notes:**

* Some users have reported success by moving files from NTFS to ReFS drives and creating symbolic links.
* Other users have seen improvements by ensuring all involved apps are up to date.

**Overall, the issue is being actively addressed by the Pieces team but requires further investigation and a permanent fix.**

common_issues.title: Copilot Vague Response and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report the Pieces Copilot responding with vague promises of future solutions instead of actionable responses. This occurs after approximately 20 requests in a session. Additionally, slow performance, unresponsiveness, and file loading issues are frequently reported. Proposed solutions include switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM and updates to the Pieces OS and Desktop applications.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @seantiz experienced a bug where the copilot wasn't responding to questions after 11 requests and responses.
* Files weren't loading into the context.
* The issue couldn't be reproduced.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot malfunctioning after a certain number of requests.
* Files not loading into the context.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggested switching to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be fixed when using the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* The issue will be monitored after the next update (11.2.3).
* @seantiz is encouraged to reach out again if the problem persists.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of the Github Issue on Copilot Performance

**Key Points Raised:**

- The application was significantly slower than before.
- Hard reset did not seem to help with the latency.
- Users experienced issues with context file reading.

**Problems Identified:**

- A bug causing the websocket not to reinitialize properly after hard reset.
- The system became unresponsive, hanging with infinitely loading indicators.
- Performance issues, slow responses, and high CPU usage continued even after the update.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- A fix was pushed in the queue to be released the same week.
- Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop versions were released with the fix implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- Users reported the fix worked well for some time, with improvements in speed and reliability.
- However, the issues resurfaced in a later update, leading to performance problems for some users again.
- Further updates and solutions were rolled out, including version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app, to address the continuing performance challenges.

Overall, the initial issue has been fixed with some users experiencing improvement. However, further investigation and fixes may be required for consistent and smooth performance for everyone.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (@bpluly) reported several issues with PiecesOS, including slow performance and crashes.
* The issue was automatically triaged and assigned to a support team member.
* Several related issues were suggested for reference.
* User uninstalled PiecesOS due to the negative experience.
* @mark-at-pieces, a support representative, reached out to the user and offered a call to discuss the issues and troubleshoot.

**Problems Identified:**

* Slow performance, even after updating to LTM-2.
* PiecesOS crashing.
* Boot-up issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Debugging session offered by @mark-at-pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the user accepted the debugging session offer.
* Issue remains open.

common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various bugs in PiecesOS, including installation failures with Ollama on Linux due to sandbox limitations, issues with LTM-2 example on macOS, and launch problems on Windows. related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Pieces Ollama Installation Issue: Summary

**Key Points:**

* Ollama installation is failing in Pieces-OS because `curl` is not accessible in the sandbox environment.
* The issue affects both inference and downloading of local LLM models.
* Users are unable to utilize local LLMs, which raises concerns about data privacy.

**Problems Identified:**

* `curl` package is missing in Pieces-OS snap environment.
* Sandbox limitations prevent access to executables outside the sandbox.
* Incomplete and misleading communication about package confinement.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` to the dependency package list in the snap definition file.
* Patch to allow Ollama usage within a sandbox environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch is still under development.
* Latest version available via snap does not resolve the issue.
* ETA for fix is unknown.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are urging for a quicker resolution due to limitations imposed by the bug.
* Data privacy concerns are being raised due to the reliance on cloud LLMs.
* Updates on the progress are requested by users.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of high-frequency issues:** Focus on addressing the 'Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Performance Issues', 'Copilot Vague Response and Performance Issues', and 'PiecesOS Installation and Functionality Bugs' as they have the highest frequency and impact user experience.
**Investigate LTM-2 related problems:** Many reported issues are linked to LTM-2, suggesting a need for thorough investigation and potential optimization or bug fixes.
**Improve Pieces OS and Desktop application stability:** Address launch failures, slow startup times, and connection issues to ensure a seamless user experience.
**Enhance communication about known issues:** Proactively inform users about known issues like Ollama installation failures on Linux and sandbox limitations to manage expectations.
**Provide clear guidance on troubleshooting:** Offer detailed instructions for common issues, including reinstalling, restarting, and replacing corrupted files.
**Consider expanding support resources:** Given the volume of issues and user activity, explore options for scaling support operations, such as additional staff or improved self-service resources.
**Analyze and address root causes:** Implement a system for tracking and analyzing the root causes of support tickets to identify recurring problems and implement permanent solutions.
**Gather user feedback on proposed solutions:** Encourage users to provide feedback on the effectiveness of proposed solutions to ensure they adequately address the reported problems.
**Monitor and address performance issues proactively:** Implement monitoring tools to detect and address performance issues before they escalate into widespread problems.
**Improve error messaging and logging:** Enhance error messages to provide users with more specific information and improve logging to facilitate faster and more efficient troubleshooting.
